蒁字的基本解释

蒁
shù
草名。
中国唐、宋本草学家称姜科植物莪术、郁金、姜黄等的肥厚根茎为“蒁”。

蒁字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shù］
［《廣韻》于筆切，入質，云。］
(1)草名。
(2)唐、宋本草学家对姜科植物蓬莪术、郁金、姜黄等的肥厚根茎的统称。又分别称“蓬莪术”为“蒁”，称“郁金”为“馬蒁”，称“姜黄”为“蒁藥”。参见宋唐慎微《政和证类本草·草部》。

蒁字的康熙字典解释
蒁字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
蒁字的起名意思

暂无。

蒁
Basic explanation of words
蒁
shù
Cursive name.
Chinese herbalists in the Tang and Song dynasties called the thick rhizomes of ginger plants such as turmeric, turmeric, and turmeric as "蒁".
蒁
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shù］
["Guangyun" cuts through the brush, enters the quality, and cloud. ]
(1) Cursive name.
(2) Tang and Song herbalists collectively referred to the hypertrophic rhizomes of ginger plants such as curcuma turmeric, turmeric and turmeric. It is also called "Peng Curcuma" as "蒁", "Turmeric" as "Ma 蒁", and "Turmeric" as "蒁 medicament". See Song Tang Shenwei "Politics and Syndicate Materia Medica·Caobu".
蒁
